programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '90s - Robin Williams (10/14/81)
programme.desc: In his first appearance on The Tonight Show, Robin admits he was a geeky kid, discusses herpes, and more.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '90s - Robin Williams (9/19/91)
programme.desc: Comic genius Robin Williams rips into Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '90s - Robin Williams (7/22/82)
programme.desc: Robin discusses the cancellation of his hit TV series Mork and Mindy, and his new movie.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Robin Williams, Phyllis Newman (4/3/84)
programme.desc: Robin Williams crawls and imitates his infant son. Phyllis Newman shares that her mother was psychic.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Robin Williams, Jonathan Winters (9/19/91)
programme.desc: Robin Williams has a raucous interview. Jonathan Winters worries about his pets falling down in an earthquake.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '70s - Bruce Dern (3/2/78)
programme.desc: Robert Klein reports on making a movie with Burt Reynolds and Dr. Carl Sagan bashes Star Wars.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '60s - Buddy Hackett (10/16/80)
programme.desc: Buddy Hackett has knowledge on many subjects, including snakes. Plus Dr. Morris Goldberg talks chauffeuring.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Super Dave Osborne (2/10/89)
programme.desc: Stand-up master Super Dave Osborne sends up President George Bush, VP Dan Quayle and….reggae music!

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '50s - Jack Benny (1/17/73)
programme.desc: Jack Benny talks about his NBC special and Rick Little impersonates celebrities.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Betty White (11/12/81)
programme.desc: Betty White critiques Johnny’s sketch comedy performance and quizzes him on the wonders of nature.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '50s - Orson Welles (9/23/76)
programme.desc: Orson Welles (Citizen Kane) discusses his radio, theatre and movie career which spanned over 5 decades.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Dan Aykroyd (6/25/87)
programme.desc: Dan Aykroyd talks Dragnet and Bobby Kelton performs stand-up. Helen Shaver also appears.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '60s - Carl Reiner (10/5/89)
programme.desc: Carl chats about wife Estelle, a nose injury, forgetfulness, and When Harry Met Sally, by his son Rob Reiner.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Best Of Jerry Seinfeld (4/6/82)
programme.desc: Jerry Seinfeld and Charles Grodin share loads of laughs over eyeglasses, doctor visits, and bowling shoes.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '70s - Bruce Dern (12/14/72)
programme.desc: ‘The use of “Bruce,”’ grouses actor Bruce Dern is Hollywood-speak for a “delicate” actor.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '70s - Jodie Foster (3/4/83)
programme.desc: Yale student and movie star Jodie Foster chats about college life and working with Peter O’Toole.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '70s - Gene Hackman (3/21/74)
programme.desc: Oscar-winner Gene Hackman shows a watery clip from ocean liner disaster flick Poseidon Adventure.
